text: Pius Adebola Adesanmi (27 February 1972"Pius Adesanmi: Nigerian image is a burden" (interview), EverythinLiterature, 1 July 2007. â€“ 10 March 2019) was a Nigerian-born Canadian professor, writer, literary critic, satirist, and columnist. He was the author of Naija No Dey Carry Last. In 2015, he gave a TED talk titled "Africa is the forward that the world needs to face". Adesanmi died on 10 March 2019, when Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 crashed shortly after take-off. ==References== ==Other websites== *In Pius Adesanmi's speech and writing, there is hope for a Pan-African future (February 2016) LSE Summit Interview *Articles by Pius Adesanmi Category:2019 deaths Category:1972 births Category:Aviation deaths Category:Canadian critics category:Literary critics Category:Canadian columnists Category:Nigerian writers Category:University of British Columbia alumni
